metadata.subject: Cause and Effect - Fade the Trump risk premium â€“ buy USD
metadata.sender: David Woo, Bank of America Merrill Lynch

relationships.description: David Woo is the FX, Rates & EM Strategist at Bank of America Merrill Lynch
The Trump administration represents Republican Party leadership and policies
Collaborators on the Ryan-Brady tax reform plan

analysis.purpose: To provide investment analysis and trading recommendations regarding USD strength and Trump administration policies
analysis.significance: Professional financial analysis of early Trump administration economic policies and their market implications

notable_quotes: Investors appear to have become concerned about upside risk to inflation and downside risk to growth.
We argue why the Trump risk premium may be too high.
We recommend buying a 6w ATM EUR put/USD call.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - document is professional financial analysis

illegal_activity.description: Document contains standard financial analysis and investment recommendations with no illegal activity

details: Reference to Wall Street Journal interview with President Trump

public_knowledge.context: Analysis of publicly known Trump administration policies and economic data

analysis.summary: This Bank of America Merrill Lynch research report analyzes market concerns about stagflation risks under the Trump administration, arguing that fears about trade wars and tax reform delays are overstated and recommending a bullish USD trading strategy based on expected policy outcomes.
